headline: Epstein files hand French prosecutors trove of new leads
subhead: The Paris prosecutor's office opened two investigations on Wednesday: one into 'human trafficking' and the other regarding 'financial offenses such as money laundering, breaches of probity, or tax fraud.'

headline: Christine Lagarde may leave European Central Bank before end of term
France's image deteriorates in the eyes of American investors
Zuckerberg tells jury he regrets slow progress on spotting under-13s on Instagram
subhead: The court in Los Angeles heard Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's testimony, as plaintiff lawyer Mark Lanier pressed him on age verification and his guiding philosophy for decision-making at the vast social media company he controls.

headline: How Ukraine adapts the defense of its railway infrastructure as Russian attacks intensify
subhead: With Russia having carried out more strikes against Ukraine's railways in 2025 than in 2023 and 2024 combined, the national railway company has decided to reinforce train armor, use anti-drone jamming tools and run more trains at night.

headline: In 'Coutures,' Alice Winocour explores the fashion world amid a backdrop of hospital melodrama
subhead: The director sets star actress Angelina Jolie in the world behind the scenes of fashion week, switching a satire of the fashion industry for a more intimate story.

headline: Patrick Artus: 'The unpopular reforms France nevertheless needs to undertake'
subhead: In his column, the economist outlines five measures, already implemented abroad, which he believes could benefit France's economy, employment and social welfare system.

headline: Trump warns UK not to 'give away' a key base as US mulls Iran attack
Eight of nine skiers missing in California avalanche found dead
Israel conducting 'gradual de facto annexation' of West Bank, UN official says
Merz says Germany does not need same fighter jets as France
Europe is divided over Trump's Board of Peace
Mélenchon's strategy of conflict under fire after far-right activist's killing
Hacker accessed data from 1.2 million bank accounts, French Economy Ministry says
Is it ever a good idea to… wear cufflinks?
Eleven arrested in probe over far-right activist's death, with far-left group under scrutiny
France's hard-left LFI party evacuates headquarters over 'bomb threat'
Leila Shahid, former Palestinian diplomat, has died
Epstein scandal divides the MAGA world and weakens Trump
Anthropic, the AI start-up that dares to defy Donald Trump
subhead: Dario Amodei, the CEO of the artificial intelligence company, acknowledged disagreements with the White House over the regulation and military use of his technology. This is a rare stance in the US, where the tech industry has generally pledged allegiance to the president.

headline: Kyiv's fourth winter at war has spared no one
subhead: In the freezing Ukrainian capital, residents are regularly without heat and electricity. People get by through resourcefulness and solidarity, living with a sense of inevitability.

headline: The Epstein case: Thirty years of judicial negligence, at the expense of victims
subhead: The first complaints against the millionaire date back to 1996. Yet between his initial conviction in 2008 and his arrest in the summer of 2019, he was never troubled by the justice system.

headline: 'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
After Munich Security Conference, Europeans have a duty to unite
'Today, 96% of the world's nuclear weapons are held by states with authoritarian leaders'
